column5: Talked to Remi at Arctic Watershed Outposts, Nakina. He advised they have about 2 feet of snow in the "bush". They are in need of a lot of snow to increase the water levels for next years lake levels. Happy holidays to all.

If you wanted to see snow, here is a picture taken on our lake in the Dryden area today. The snow is deeper in the bush (maybe a foot), but to date we have had less snow and warmer temps than usual. The lakes are down a lot, more snow would be a good thing.http://i1178.photobucket.com/albums/...itledSmall.jpg
nice pic. nothing like brite white snow
